description.en-us: CTE-Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Agribusiness Systems
Demonstrate an understanding of the agribusiness systems career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the agribusiness systems career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the agribusiness systems career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in agribusiness systems career pathway.
Research the history of the agribusiness systems career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the agribusiness systems career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the agribusiness systems career pathway.
Identify components of agribusiness.
Describe the business cycle.
Complete a profit and loss statement.
Distinguish between types of competition practices.
Demonstrate proper methods of recording merchandise.
Summarize proper use of customer service skills.
Explain proper management techniques.
Apply knowledge and skills in agricultural processing and marketing.
Identify processing and packaging techniques used in agriculture.
Discuss the difference in marketing strategies between perishable and nonperishable commodities.
Develop a merchandising plan for an agricultural product.
Identify and compare USDA standards and grades for agricultural products.
Describe how processing, packaging, and marketing affects the price of an item.
Recognize misleading advertising.
Describe how competition benefits the consumer.
Record the market price of an agricultural commodity over a period of time.
Construct a floral design.
Compare and contrast historical and cultural contributions to design.
Identify types of arrangements and products.
Demonstrate knowledge of floral pricing.
Verify flowers by common and scientific name.
Assemble a floral arrangement.
Summarize knowledge of inventory skills.
Develop a marketing plan.
